intro: Centaurium roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan chickweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its delicate, upright stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Centaurium roxburghii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
